original_title: 2024 Business Card Challenge: Integrated Game Card
original_content:
[Dan Schnur] has a simple strategy to ensure their business card stays on the clients desk and doesnt just get lobbed in a drawer: make it into a simple gaming platform. This entry into the 2024 Business Card Challenge is based around the tinyjoypad project, integrating an SSD1306 OLED display, joypad, and push button.
Powered by the superstar ATTiny85, the electronics are really not all that much, just a sprinkling of passives to support the display and the six switch inputs from the joystick and push button. Or at least, thats how much we can glean from the PCB images, as the PCB design files are not provided in the project GitHub.
Leaving the heavy lifting of the software to the tinyjoypad project, the designer can concentrate on the actual job at hand and the reason the business card exists to stay at the forefront of the clients mind. In the meantime, the card can be a useful distraction for those idle moments. A few such distractions include a tiny version of Missile Command (as shown above), tiny tris, and a very cut-down Q-bert.  Sadly, that last game isnt quite the same without that distinctive sound.
title: ビジネスカードをゲーミングプラットフォームに変身させる！
body: Dan Schnurは、ビジネスカードを単なる引き出しの中に捨てられることなく、クライアントのデスクに置かれるようにする簡単な戦略を持っています。2024年のビジネスカードチャレンジに応募した彼のビジネスカードは、SSD1306 OLEDディスプレイ、ジョイパッド、プッシュボタンを統合したtinyjoypadプロジェクトに基づいています。
